meanings.definition: To be stingy or frugal in spending or using resources.
meanings.sent1: She was skimping on her allowance, saving every penny.
meanings.sent2: The company was skimping on office supplies to cut costs.
meanings.sent3: He tried skimping on ingredients for the cake, but it turned out flat.
meanings.sent4: Skimping on safety measures is like playing with fire.
meanings.sent5: Skimping on sleep can lead to health problems in the long run.

meanings.definition: To give something insufficient attention or effort.
meanings.sent1: The student was skimping on studying for the exam.
meanings.sent2: The chef was skimping on seasoning, resulting in a bland dish.
meanings.sent3: She was skimping on cleaning her room, hoping no one would notice.
meanings.sent4: Skimping on practice won't lead to improvement in sports.
meanings.sent5: Skimping on details can make a project look sloppy.
